articles.content:
Pyongyang Visiting Group of S. Korean Youth and Students Arrives 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang visiting group of south Korean youth and students arrived here yesterday.
 The visiting group was greeted at the airport by Ri Myong Won, secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and officials of the Korean Student Committee and the North Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification.

articles.title: Letters and Gifts to Kim Jong Il
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Letters and Gifts to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a letter from Igori Moiseyev, founder of the Russian Moiseyev State Academy Folk Dance Troupe, and a congratulatory letter from the head of the visiting troupe.
 And he received gifts from the troupe and its head.    
 Manager of the dance troupe Yelena Shervakova who is heading the troupe conveyed them to an official concerned on Sept. 21.

articles.title: Lively Response Evoked by Military Parade Held in DPRK
Jong Ha Chol Meets Delegation of Moscow Journalists Union
Russian Dance Troupe Performs for Guests of Honor
articles.content:
Jong Ha Chol Meets Delegation of Moscow Journalists Union
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- Jong Ha Chol, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly conversation with the visiting delegation of the Moscow Journalists Union of Russia headed by Timofey Kuznetsov, deputy editor-in-chief of "Rossiskaya Gazeta," the organ of the Government, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.  Present on the occasion were Kim Song Guk, chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Journalists Union, and officials concerned and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov. 
 The head of the delegation said the delegation was pleased to visit the DPRK at a time when the friendly and cooperative relations between Russia and the DPRK are favorably developing day by day, adding that the union would positively contribute to boosting the Russia-DPRK friendly and cooperative ties in the future.    
 He hoped that the Korean people would register still greater success in their efforts to achieve the prosperity of the country and accomplish their cause of reunification by dint of their single-hearted unity.

articles.title: Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russia
Greetings to President of Mali
articles.content:
Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russia
    Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 4th meeting of the Sub-Committee for Scientific and Technological Cooperation of the Committee for Trade, Economic and Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the Governments of the DPRK and Russia was inked here on Sept. 21.
 Present at the signing ceremony were officials concerned from the DPRK side and the members of the delegation of the Russian Ministry of Industry, Science and Technology and a staff member of the Russian Embassy here from the other side.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Malta
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mali
    Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Sept. 18 sent a message of greetings to Amadou Toumani Toure, president of Mali and head of state, on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic of Mali.
 Expressing the belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of the nation.

articles.title: Greetings to Armenian President
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Malta
    Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Sept. 21 sent a message of greetings to Guido De Marco, president of Malta, on the occasion of the 39th anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, and sincerely wished the president good health and happiness.

articles.title: First Vice-Chairman of NDC Meets Russian Artistes
articles.content:
Greetings to Armenian President
    Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Sept. 21 sent a message of greetings to Robert Kocharyan, president of Armenia, on the occasion of its national day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, and wished the president great success in his work for the prosperity of the country as well as the Armenian people happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Remaining True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
First Vice-Chairman of NDC Meets Russian Artistes
    Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Jo Myong Rok, first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, met and conversed in a friendly atmosphere with the leading members and principal actors and actresses of the visiting Russian Moiseyev State Academy Folk Dance Troupe led by its Manager Yelena Shervakova at the Mansudae Art Theatre Sunday.
 Present there were Kim Il Chol, Jon Pyong Ho and Jong Ha Chol and Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
